items.preText: If you're in the Americas, then watch the game LIVE on WATCH ESPN. 10.39am Time for the national anthems. First, Bangladesh's Amar Sonar Bangla followed by Ireland's Call 10.25am Bangladesh have rested Soumya Sarkar, Mohammad Mithun, Mehidy Hasan Miraz and Mustafizur Rahman, and have brought in Liton Das to open with Tamim Iqbal, as well as Mosaddek Hossain, Mohammad Saifuddin and Rubel Hossain. Saifuddin returns from a back spasm he sustained before Bangladesh's previous match. 10.15am Ireland have won the toss and chose to bat. Ireland: 1 Paul Stirling, 2 James McCollum, 3, Andy Balbirnie, 4 William Porterfield (capt), 5 Kevin O'Brien, 6 Mark Adair, 7 Gary Wilson (wk), 8 George Dockrell, 9 Boyd Rankin, 10 Barry McCarthy, 11 Josh Little Bangladesh: 1 Tamim Iqbal, 2 Liton Das, 3 Shakib Al Hasan, 4 Mushfiqur Rahman, 5 Mahmudullah, 6 Mashrafe Mortaza, 7 Sabbir Rahman, 8 Rubel Hossain, 9 Abu Jayed, 10 Mosaddek Hossain, 11 Mohammad Saifuddin Ramim: "Please don't try with bench strength cause Bangladesh will make it costlier by loosing one!! " 10.12am If you're looking for a nice story to dig into as we build up to the toss, look no further. Melinda Farrell caught up with Eoin Morgan and his family to trace his journey from Ireland to England. It's a delightful read. 10.05am Conditions today are expected to be cloudy, but dry. Perfect time then to dig into our match preview, which lists out the possible tweaks we could see in the Bangladesh XI. Sohel Melbourne: "Really want to see Taskin and Liton gets a game today to prepare well before WC knocking the door. Mahmudullah and Tamim should should be taken rest to get freshen up for the final. Waiting from Melbourne Australia to support my team. Good luck Tigers !" 9.55am In normal circumstances, today's ODI between Ireland and Bangladesh would be a dead rubber, but with a World Cup approaching, no game is meaningless. Bangladesh are ensured of a spot in the tri-series final with West Indies, on the back of two wins against the Caribbean side. But Ireland have shown there are no pushovers. They went down easily against WI in their first game, but roared back to nearly pull an upset against them in the reverse fixture. Had Ireland's first scheduled fixture v Bangladesh not been a washout, things could've been much different in the series. But as it stands, Ireland have another rare opportunity to beat a full-member team and Bangladesh have their second-last official ODI before the World Cup. What can we expect today? Let's find out together as I, Sreshth Shah, and Shashank Kishore welcome you to ESPNcricinfo's coverage of the 6th game of the tri-nation series.
items.text: full, just outside off, angling away. Left alone
items.shortText: Abu Jayed to Stirling, no run

items.text: full, on middle and a bit of shape on this one. He prods forward to drive towards mid-on
items.shortText: Abu Jayed to Stirling, no run
Abu Jayed to Stirling, no run

items.text: length ball, wide outside off, and he flays this away off the front foot. Crunched through the covers for the day's first runs
items.shortText: Abu Jayed to Stirling, FOUR runs

items.text: length ball on leg, and flicked off his pads to the leg side. Fine leg runs across to intercept
items.shortText: Abu Jayed to Stirling, 2 runs

items.text: length ball on middle, and angling into leg stump again. Worked off his pads to the leg side
items.shortText: Abu Jayed to Stirling, no run

items.text: full, on off, and he meets the ball on the front foot. Pushed back to Rubel
items.shortText: Rubel Hossain to McCollum, no run

items.text: flicked! Full, on his pads, and he closes his bat's face to put this strayer away
items.shortText: Rubel Hossain to McCollum, FOUR runs

items.text: too good a shot for just a single. Length ball, wide outside off, and he cuts this square but straight to point. Misfield allows for a single
items.shortText: Rubel Hossain to McCollum, 1 run

items.text: length ball, wide enough for Stirling to throw his hands at it. Cut in front of square, and two men give the ball a mighty chase
items.shortText: Rubel Hossain to Stirling, 2 runs

items.text: back of a length, just outside off, and firmly punched off the back foot to cover
items.shortText: Rubel Hossain to Stirling, no run

items.text: length ball, angling into his hips, and comfortably flicked off his pads to deep backward square
items.shortText: Rubel Hossain to Stirling, 2 runs

items.text: length ball, on off, and he prods forward to defend towards cover
items.shortText: Abu Jayed to McCollum, no run

items.text: length ball, on off, and shaping away after hitting the deck. McCollum doesn't commit, getting his bat out of the ball's way in time
items.shortText: Abu Jayed to McCollum, no run

items.text: huge lbw appeal but not given. Length ball, on middle and shaping towards off. Hits him in front of off, but the ball is probably going high. A bit of sound too, but unsure what that came from
items.shortText: Abu Jayed to McCollum, no run

items.text: full, on off, and he presses forward to defend to cover
items.shortText: Abu Jayed to McCollum, no run

items.text: length ball on middle, and going down leg
items.shortText: Abu Jayed to McCollum, 1 wide

items.text: length ball, wide outside off, and punched to cover
items.shortText: Abu Jayed to McCollum, no run

items.text: fuller, just outside off and shaping away. McCollum tries to play the straight drive, but the ball whizzes past his outside edge
items.shortText: Abu Jayed to McCollum, no run

items.text: full on middle, and he works it away to midwicket. No chance of a single
items.shortText: Rubel Hossain to Stirling, no run

items.text: full on off, and he walks across to the off side, before driving to mid-on. Stopped once again
items.shortText: Rubel Hossain to Stirling, no run

items.text: hammered! Back of a length, just outside off, and he drags a pull into the stands. What a shot
items.postText: Hamad: "Morning from Italy, hope Bangladesh gets a target near to 300 so they can test their batting skills and strength. Wanna see some interesting chase from the tigers. Meanwhile its getting diffucult for the neighbours to win a single one in the english conditions. Lol. Just for fun!! Well, dont get surprised I am from Pakistan!!" -- Ireland made 320+ against WI, so it's possible.
items.shortText: Rubel Hossain to Stirling, SIX runs

items.text: full, on off, and he drives to mid-on once again. Misfield allows them to pinch a single
items.postText: Mohammad Isam: "It is interesting how the team management in Ireland have dealt with the Taskin Ahmed question. A few days ago it was almost confirmed that Taskin would be picked in the World Cup squad, possibly in place of Abu Jayed. Next day, Jayed makes his ODI debut against West Indies, and having gone wicketless, it was assumed that he was picked in that game to give the team management, selectors and BCB president the reason to drop him. But today, Jayed is picked ahead of Taskin in a dead rubber in which they have also brought in other World Cup squad members. If Taskin isn't playing today, he may not make it to the WC squad after all."
items.shortText: Rubel Hossain to Stirling, 1 run

items.text: got him! Taken at first slip. Length ball, wide outside off and McCollum goes fishing. Tries to punch off the back foot, and this has taken the outside edge. Disappointing for the man who scored a hundred against Bangladesh in the A-game
items.shortText: Rubel Hossain to McCollum, OUT

dismissal.text: JA McCollum c Liton Das b Rubel Hossain 5 (10b 1x4 0x6) SR: 50.00

items.text: full, on off, and defended back to Rubel
items.postText: OB Jato: "Hossain is a Rubel without a cause ;)"
items.shortText: Rubel Hossain to Balbirnie, no run
